# Material.css

*This CSS library was generated by Claude.*

A classless CSS library following Material Design 3. No classes. Just clean, modern styling for semantic HTML.

## Quick Start

```html
<link rel="stylesheet" href="material.css">
```

Write semantic HTML, get a Material Design. No classes required.

```html
<body>
  <h1>Hello, World.</h1>
  <p>A paragraph with <strong>bold</strong> and <em>italic</em> text.</p>
  <button>Click Me</button>
</body>
```

## Features

- **Classless** — Style every HTML element without adding a single class
- **Zero dependencies** — Just one CSS file, no JavaScript
- **Typography** — Display headings, body text, inline elements
- **Lists** — Unordered, ordered, and definition lists
- **Code blocks** — Syntax-highlighted pre/code with terminal styling
- **Forms** — Text inputs, selects, textareas, checkboxes, radio buttons
- **Tables** — Complete with headers, footers, and row hover states
- **Buttons** — Filled, tonal, outlined, and disabled states
- **Details** — Accordion/expansion panels
- **Dialog** — Native modal styling with scrim backdrop
- **Navigation** — Horizontal nav bar with pill-shaped items
- **Responsive** — Works on mobile, tablet, and desktop
- **Print styles** — Clean output for printing
- **Accessibility** — Focus-visible outlines, proper contrast ratios

## Design

- **Font**: DM Sans (body/display) + DM Mono (code)
- **Colors**: Material Design 3 tonal palette with primary blue
- **Style**: Tonal surfaces, elevation shadows, rounded corners
- **States**: Hover, focus, and pressed state layers

## Browser Support

- Chrome / Edge (latest)
- Firefox (latest)
- Safari (latest)
